instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01598 dead pp5v
threads.message:
fan speed for 2 second then stop and start again and do not stop, no keyboard activity 
there was damage at L8504 ( PP5V_G3S_ALSCAM-PP5V_G3S_CPUREG_MISC)near screen connector and whiteout screen SHOW 0.2V

threads.title: 820-01598 dead pp5v
threads.message:
The problem could be caused by some short inside video cable.
Disconnect J8500 and check for USB activity and external video.

threads.title: 820-01598 dead pp5v
threads.message: o.k i was find that the  PP5V_G3S_CPUREG_MISC line was cut so i make jumper and i have 5.3v now, but still just fan spin and cpu is cold, there is usb activity, no screen also no charging sound and no video with external screen.

threads.title: 820-01598 dead pp5v
threads.message: cpu warm a little bit..

threads.title: 820-01598 dead pp5v
threads.message:
PPBUS_G3H = 12.63V
PP3v3_G3H = 3.4V
PP1V8_SLPS2R = 1.8V
PP1V8_AWAKE = 1.8V
PP1V1_SLPS2R = 1.1V
PP0V8_SLPS2R = 0.79V
PP3V3_AWAKE = 3.4V
PP1V2_AWAKE = 1.19V
PMU_PVDDMAIN_EN = 3.3V
P3V3MAIN_PGOOD = 3.26V
PP3V_G3H_RTC = 3.0V
PCH_RTC_RESET_L = 3.0V
P5VG3S_EN = 1.8 V
PP5V_G3S = 5.4V 

L9080- PP2V5_NAND_SSD0 short!

threads.title: 820-01598 dead pp5v
threads.message: 0.22ohm

threads.title: 820-01598 dead pp5v
threads.message:
sorry my mistake!! no short on  PP2V5_NAND_SSD0 
L9080 both sides, dido mode to ground 350
L9030 PPVCCQ_ANI_SSD0 412 - PVCCQ_LX0 nothing.
L9020 PP0V9_SSD0 430 - PVDD_LX1 nothing

threads.title: 820-01598 dead pp5v
threads.message:
"there is usb activity"
Did you see flashing Link LED on USB device???

Check if machine is detected in DFU mode.

threads.title: 820-01598 dead pp5v
threads.message:
"Yes the is light on the adapter they I connect."
Light on means steady light?
The activity can be checked with Link LED, which MUST flash; read "How To colecction" thread.

Is now detected in DFU?
Try the board disconnecting keyboard/trackpad.

threads.title: 820-01598 dead pp5v
threads.message:
Most likely T2 damaged by liquid spill.
Any liquid sign at audio board, flex, or connector?

threads.title: 820-01598 dead pp5v
threads.message: no liquid damage but i will look, where is the audio area?

threads.title: 820-01598 dead pp5v
threads.message: at the audio area the PP1V8_MESA is missing

threads.title: 820-01598 dead pp5v
threads.message: PP3V3_G3H_RTC_MESA 3.3v so 4920 is bad?

threads.title: 820-01598 dead pp5v
threads.message:
J6600 connects with audio flex and board.
Did you check all for liquid signs???

threads.title: 820-01598 dead pp5v
threads.message:
I was talking about audio BOARD and audio FLEX, apart of audio connector.
Leakage from PPBUS_G3H to T2 data lines mostly occurs on these components.

Remove audio board and inspect both sides for corrosion.

threads.title: 820-01598 dead pp5v
threads.message:
If you have all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages, it should be detected in DFU.
If not, bad T2...
